AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Nancy F. Atlas: Judge reviewing Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's motion for relief from his sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya: Defendant convicted of conspiracy to commit hostage taking and seeking relief from his sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States of America: Plaintiff responding to Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's motion for relief
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.a United States Federal Grand Jury: Grand jury that returned the superseding indictment against Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya and co-defendants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Sentencing Guidelines: Manual used for determining punishment under the United States sentencing guidelines, relevant to Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's claim of incorrect sentence calculation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the conspiracy to commit hostage taking: Conspiracy offense for which Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya was convicted
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the hostage taking: Offense related to the conspiracy for which Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya was convicted
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the ransom demand: Ransom demand made during the commission of the offense
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the other defendants: Co-defendants of Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya in the superseding indictment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the superseding indictment: Indictment returned by the United States Federal Grand Jury against Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya and co-defendants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.count four of the superseding indictment: Count under which Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya was convicted of conspiracy to commit hostage taking
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Presentence Report: Report prepared by the Probation Department for Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's sentencing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the dangerous weapon used in connection: Weapon used during the commission of the offense, resulting in an increased sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.The United States Court of Appeals for t: Court that affirmed Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's conviction and sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Supreme Court: Highest court in the United States, which could have been appealed to by filing a petition for a writ of certiorari
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Adrian Almaguer: Attorney for Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya, whose performance is being questioned
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the supplemental verdict: Verdict that includes findings used to determine Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's sentence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the affidavit of Adrian Almaguer: Document submitted by Adrian Almaguer in support of his argument regarding Jose Marlon Ibarra-Zelaya's sentence enhancements
